stories.text:
Title is pretty much it. I joined Oracle a few months ago after applying to a dev position. As soon I joined, I was assigned Operations work which to be honest is not what I was hoping for. I was wondering if anyone else in the HN community experienced something like this before? Is this common in bigger companies where it's more "Closing Jira Tickets" than actual coding work? Is this gonna paint me as an Ops person from now on? 
I started seriously thinking about quitting and looking elsewhere.
Thanks in advance for any feedback.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you handle being assigned Ops tasks knowing you joined to do Dev?
The In-depth Guide to ActiveRecord load_async in Rails 7
The Puzzling Virus That Infects Almost Everyone

stories.text:
Hello, HackerNews!

We are conducting a survey on how people listen and discover music. It is mostly multiple-choice with some free-form questions about how do you interact with streaming services and purchased music. After you finish the survey, the statistics of the current answers are shown, so you can also learn how others consume and interact with music.

So if you are passionate about music, and can spare 5 minutes of your time, please contribute!

The survey is anonymous, and the data will only be used for research purposes.

Link: https://forms.gle/XaGQ2emq1V3rAmgQ8
stories.title: Ask HN: Survey on music listening and discovery habits (~5 min, 18-65 y/o)
Facebook Gains Inside Role in U.S. 250th Anniversary Project with $10M Agreement
Change.org: Block AWS, Azure and Google Cloud in Russia
Why is the Linux mascot a penguin?
